meanings.sent1: I picked some thimbleberries from the bush.
meanings.sent2: The thimbleberries were delicious in the pie.
meanings.sent3: The thimbleberries rolled off the plate and onto the floor!
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as red as thimbleberries from the cold.
meanings.sent5: The scent of thimbleberries filled the air in the forest.

meanings.definition: A plant of the rose family with white flowers and prickly stems.
meanings.sent1: The thimbleberries in the garden have beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the thimbleberries' thorns when you prune them.
meanings.sent3: The thimbleberries seemed to be wearing tiny white crowns on their heads.
meanings.sent4: The thimbleberries stood out in the garden like delicate dancers.
meanings.sent5: The thimbleberries added a touch of elegance to the yard with their blooms.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the thimbleberry plant.
meanings.sent1: She made a jam using the thimbleberries she harvested.
meanings.sent2: The market sold fresh thimbleberries from the local farms.
meanings.sent3: The thimbleberries giggled as they tumbled out of the basket.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled like thimbleberries when he saw the ripe fruit.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter echoed through the orchard as they picked thimbleberries.
